info.title: Payments
info.description: Call the Payments API to authorize payments, capture authorized payments, refund payments that have already been captured, and show payment information. Use the Payments API in conjunction with the Orders API. For more information, see the PayPal Checkout Overview.

tags.name: authorizations
tags.description: Use the `/authorizations` resource to show details for, capture payment for, reauthorize, and void authorized payments.

tags.name: captures
tags.description: Use the `/captures` resource to show details for and refund a captured payment.

tags.name: refunds
tags.description: Use the `/refunds` resource to show refund details.

tags.name: cancel-payment
tags.description: Use the /cancel-payment resource to cancel an order capture or order authorization by PayPal-Request-Id. The merchant triggers the cancel action.

tags.name: find-eligible-methods
tags.description: Use the `/find-eligible-methods` resource to show list of eligible payment methods for given customer/order context.

tags.name: payment-resource-operations
tags.description: Use the `/payment-resource-operations` resource to show verifications details.

get.description: Shows details for an authorized payment, by ID.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response body that shows authorization details

401.description: Authentication failed due to missing authorization header, or invalid authentication credentials.

403.description: The request failed because the caller has insufficient permissions.

404.description: The request failed because the resource does not exist.

500.description: The request failed because an internal server error occurred.

post.description: Captures an authorized payment, by ID.

value.note_to_payer: If the ordered color is not available, we will substitute with a different color free of charge.

201.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 201 Created status code and a JSON response body that shows captured payment details

400.description: The request failed because it is not well-formed or is syntactically incorrect or violates schema.

401.description: Authentication failed due to missing authorization header, or invalid authentication credentials.

403.description: The request failed because the caller has insufficient permissions.

404.description: The request failed because the resource does not exist.

422.description: The request failed because it is semantically incorrect or failed business validation.

500.description: The request failed because an internal server error occurred.

post.description:
Reauthorizes an authorized PayPal account payment, by ID. To ensure that funds are still available, reauthorize a payment after its initial three-day honor period expires. Within the 29-day authorization period, you can issue multiple re-authorizations after the honor period expires.

If 30 days have transpired since the date of the original authorization, you must create an authorized payment instead of reauthorizing the original authorized payment.

A reauthorized payment itself has a new honor period of three days.

You can reauthorize an authorized payment from 4 to 29 days after the 3-day honor period. The allowed amount depends on context and geography, for example in US it is up to 115% of the original authorized amount, not to exceed an increase of $75 USD.

Supports only the `amount` request parameter.
Note: This request is currently not supported for Partner use cases.

201.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 201 Created status code and a JSON response body that shows the reauthorized payment details

400.description: The request failed because it is not well-formed or is syntactically incorrect or violates schema.

401.description: Authentication failed due to missing authorization header, or invalid authentication credentials.

403.description: The request failed because the caller has insufficient permissions.

404.description: The request failed because the resource does not exist.

422.description: The request failed because it either is semantically incorrect or failed business validation.

500.description: The request failed because an internal server error occurred.

post.description: Voids, or cancels, an authorized payment, by ID. You cannot void an authorized payment that has been fully captured.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response body that shows authorization details. This response is returned when the Prefer header is set to return=representation

204.description: A successful request returns the HTTP 204 No Content status code with no JSON response body. This response is returned when the Prefer header is set to return=minimal.

400.description: The request failed because it is not well-formed or is syntactically incorrect or violates schema.

401.description: Authentication failed due to missing authorization header, or invalid authentication credentials.

403.description: The request failed because the caller has insufficient permissions.

404.description: The request failed because the resource does not exist.

409.description: The request failed because a previous call for the given resource is in progress.

422.description: The request failed because it either is semantically incorrect or failed business validation.

500.description: The request failed because an internal server error occurred.

post.description: Refunds a captured payment, by ID. For a full refund, include an empty payload in the JSON request body. For a partial refund, include an amount object in the JSON request body.

SupplementaryPurchaseData.title: Capture Identifier

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives

note_to_payer.description: An informational note about this settlement. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives

SupplementaryPurchaseData.description: The capture identification-related fields. Includes the invoice ID, custom ID, note to payer, and soft descriptor

details.description: Array of detailed conflict information explaining specific issues that caused the 409 error.

CardBrand.title: Card Brand
CardBrand.description: The card network or brand. Applies to credit, debit, gift, and payment cards

details.description: Array of detailed information about the 404 not found error conditions.

details.description: Array of detailed information about the forbidden access error conditions.

DateTime.description:
The date and time, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). Seconds are required while fractional seconds are optional.
Note: The regular expression provides guidance but does not reject all invalid dates.

details.description: Array of detailed error information for unauthorized access attempts.

details.description: Array of detailed error information providing specific validation or request processing issues.

PARTIALREFUNDNOTALLOWED.description: Indicates that partial refunds are not permitted; only full refunds matching the original capture amount are allowed.

Error500.title: Internal Server Error

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes

message.description: Error message indicating an internal server error has occurred on the server.

Error500.description: This is either a system or application error, and generally indicates that although the client appeared to provide a correct request, something unexpected has gone wrong on the server

issue.description: Indicates a decimal precision validation issue with the fixed value "DECIMAL_PRECISION".

description.description: Indicates that currencies supporting decimals are limited to two decimal places only.

DECIMALPRECISION1.description: Validates that decimal currencies use only two decimal place precision.

CURRENCYMISMATCH.title: CURRENCY_MISMATCH

issue.description: Indicates a currency mismatch error when currencies don't align between related transactions.

CURRENCYMISMATCH.description: Error indicating a mismatch between expected and provided currency codes in the transaction.

status_details.description: Additional details and context information related to the current refund status.

enum: Refunds are not allowed on this capture due to a chargeback on the card or bank. Please contact the payee to resolve the chargeback.
description.description: Indicates refunds are blocked due to a chargeback on the payment method requiring payee contact.

REFUNDNOTPERMITTEDDUETOCHARGEBACK.description: Refunds are not allowed on this capture due to a chargeback on the card or bank.

PAYERCANNOTPAY.title: PAYER_CANNOT_PAY

issue.description: Indicates that the payer is unable to complete the payment transaction.

enum: Payer cannot pay for this transaction. Please contact the payer to find other ways to pay for this transaction.
description.description: Standard message indicating the payer cannot complete the transaction and should be contacted for alternative payment methods.

PAYERCANNOTPAY.description: Indicates the payer lacks sufficient funds or means to complete the transaction payment.

ReauthorizeRequest.title: Reauthorize Request
ReauthorizeRequest.description:
Reauthorizes an authorized PayPal account payment, by ID. To ensure that funds are still available, reauthorize a payment after its initial three-day honor period expires. You can reauthorize a payment only once from days four to 29.

If 30 days have transpired since the date of the original authorization, you must create an authorized payment instead of reauthorizing the original authorized payment.

A reauthorized payment itself has a new honor period of three days.

You can reauthorize an authorized payment once. The allowed amount depends on context and geography, for example in US it is up to 115% of the original authorized amount, not to exceed an increase of $75 USD.

Supports only the `amount` request parameter.
Note: This request is currently not supported for Partner use cases.

UnauthorizedErrorResponse.description: Error response returned when the request lacks valid authentication credentials (HTTP 401).

BadRequestErrorResponse.description: HTTP 400 Bad Request error response containing error details and bad request information.

ErrorDetails.title: Error Details

field.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors

issue.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code

description.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value

value.description: The value of the field that caused the error

ErrorDetails.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors

ForbiddenAccessErrorResponse.description: Error response returned when access to a resource is forbidden due to insufficient permissions.

issue.description: Indicates an invalid account status error with the value "INVALID_ACCOUNT_STATUS".

enum: Account validations failed for the user.
description.description: Account validation failure message indicating the user's account status is invalid.

INVALIDACCOUNTSTATUS.description: Account validation error indicating the user's account status is invalid or does not meet requirements.

NotFoundErrorResponse.description: Standard HTTP 404 error response indicating the requested resource could not be found.

TRANSACTIONREFUSED1.title: TRANSACTION_REFUSED

issue.description: Indicates that the transaction was refused, with the fixed value "TRANSACTION_REFUSED".

description.description: PayPal's internal controls prevent authorization from being captured.

TRANSACTIONREFUSED1.description: Transaction refused due to PayPal's internal controls preventing authorization capture.

SellerReceivableBreakdown.title: Seller Receivable Breakdown

platform_fees.description: An array of platform or partner fees, commissions, or brokerage fees that associated with the captured payment

exchange_rate.description: Exchange rate applied to convert currency amounts in the seller receivable breakdown.

paypal_fee.description: The PayPal fee amount deducted from the transaction, expressed as a monetary value.

gross_amount.description: The total gross amount before deductions, represented as a monetary value.

paypal_fee_in_receivable_currency.description: The PayPal fee amount expressed in the receivable currency for this seller transaction.

net_amount.description: The net amount due to the seller after deducting fees and adjustments from the total receivable.

receivable_amount.description: Amount due to the seller, representing the total receivable in monetary terms.

SellerReceivableBreakdown.description: The detailed breakdown of the capture activity. This is not available for transactions that are in pending state

PAYEEACCOUNTLOCKEDORCLOSED.title: PAYEE_ACCOUNT_LOCKED_OR_CLOSED

issue.description: Indicates that the payee's account is either locked or closed, preventing transaction completion.

enum: Transaction could not complete because payee account is locked or closed.
description.description: Indicates that the transaction failed because the payee's account is locked or closed.

PAYEEACCOUNTLOCKEDORCLOSED.description: Transaction cannot complete due to payee account being locked or closed.

issue.description: Indicates that platform fee functionality is not enabled for this account or transaction.

MAXCAPTUREAMOUNTEXCEEDED.title: MAX_CAPTURE_AMOUNT_EXCEEDED

issue.description: Error code indicating the capture amount exceeds the maximum allowed limit.

enum: Capture amount exceeds allowable limit. Please contact customer service or your account manager to request the change to your overage limit. The default overage limit is 115%, which allows the sum of all captures to be up to 115% of the order amount. The ability to over capture is subjected to regulatory approvals.
description.description: Error message when capture amount exceeds the configured overage limit for the order.

MAXCAPTUREAMOUNTEXCEEDED.description: Capture amount exceeds the allowable limit (default 115% of order amount).

PAYEEACCOUNTLOCKEDORCLOSED2.description: Transaction cannot complete because the payee's account is locked or closed.

CAPTUREFULLYREFUNDED.title: CAPTURE_FULLY_REFUNDED

issue.description: Indicates that a capture has been fully refunded, with the fixed value "CAPTURE_FULLY_REFUNDED".

enum: The capture has already been fully refunded
description.description: Indicates that the capture transaction has been completely refunded with no remaining balance.

CAPTUREFULLYREFUNDED.description: Indicates that a payment capture has already been completely refunded and no further refunds are possible.

ConflictErrorResponse.description: HTTP 409 Conflict error response indicating a request conflict with the current resource state.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

final_capture.description: Indicates whether you can make additional captures against the authorized payment. Set to `true` if you do not intend to capture additional payments against the authorization. Set to `false` if you intend to capture additional payments against the authorization.

note_to_payer.description: An informational note about this settlement. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

soft_descriptor.description: The payment descriptor on the payer's account statement.

CaptureRequestAllOf2.description: Additional capture request parameters including amount, invoice details, and payment instructions.

RefundRequest.title: Refund Request

custom_id.description: The API caller-provided external ID. Used to reconcile API caller-initiated transactions with PayPal transactions. Appears in transaction and settlement reports. The pattern is defined by an external party and supports Unicode

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice ID for this order. The pattern is defined by an external party and supports Unicode

note_to_payer.description: The reason for the refund. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives. The pattern is defined by an external party and supports Unicode

payment_instruction.description: Payment instruction details specifying how the refund should be processed and delivered to the recipient.

RefundRequest.description: Refunds a captured payment, by ID. For a full refund, include an empty request body. For a partial refund, include an amount object in the request body

INVALIDSTRINGMAXLENGTH.title: INVALID_STRING_MAX_LENGTH

issue.description: Indicates a validation error where a string value exceeds the maximum allowed length.

enum: The value of a field is too long.
description.description: Error message indicating that a field value exceeds the maximum allowed length.

INVALIDSTRINGMAXLENGTH.description: Validation error indicating that a string field value exceeds the maximum allowed length.

422Details.description: Error details for 422 Unprocessable Entity responses, containing specific validation or business rule violation information.

REFUNDISRESTRICTED.title: REFUND_IS_RESTRICTED

issue.description: Indicates that a refund cannot be processed due to policy or system restrictions.

enum: This refund can only be processed by the API caller that had 'captured' the transaction. If you facilitate your transactions via a platform/partner, please initiate a refund through them.
description.description: Indicates refund must be processed by the original API caller that captured the transaction.

REFUNDISRESTRICTED.description: Refund restricted to the API caller that originally captured the transaction.

PaymentInstruction2.title: Payment Instruction

platform_fees.description: Specifies the amount that the API caller will contribute to the refund being processed. The amount needs to be lower than platform_fees amount originally captured or the amount that is remaining if multiple refunds have been processed. This field is only applicable to merchants that have been enabled for PayPal Commerce Platform for Marketplaces and Platforms capability. Please speak to your account manager if you want to use this capability

PaymentInstruction2.description: Any additional payments instructions during refund payment processing. This object is only applicable to merchants that have been enabled for PayPal Commerce Platform for Marketplaces and Platforms capability. Please speak to your account manager if you want to use this capability

TRANSACTIONDISPUTED.title: TRANSACTION_DISPUTED

issue.description: Indicates the transaction has been disputed by the cardholder or financial institution.

enum: Partial refunds cannot be offered at this time because there is an open case on this transaction. Visit the PayPal Resolution Center to review this case.
description.description: Error message indicating partial refunds are blocked due to an open dispute case requiring Resolution Center review.

TRANSACTIONDISPUTED.description: Transaction cannot be partially refunded due to an open dispute case in PayPal Resolution Center.

PAYEEACCOUNTRESTRICTED1.title: PAYEE_ACCOUNT_RESTRICTED

issue.description: Indicates that the payee's account has restrictions preventing the transaction from being processed.

description.description: Indicates that the payee account has restrictions preventing normal transaction processing.

PAYEEACCOUNTRESTRICTED1.description: Indicates that the payee's account has restrictions preventing payment processing.

PAYEEACCOUNTRESTRICTED2.title: PAYEE_ACCOUNT_RESTRICTED

issue.description: Indicates that the payee's account has restrictions preventing the transaction from being processed.

description.description: Indicates that the payee account has restrictions preventing normal transaction processing.

PAYEEACCOUNTRESTRICTED2.description: Indicates that the payee's account has restrictions preventing transaction processing.

Email.description:
The internationalized email address.
Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

AccountId.title: PayPal Account Identifier
AccountId.description: The account identifier for a PayPal account

REAUTHORIZATIONNOTSUPPORTED.title: REAUTHORIZATION_NOT_SUPPORTED

issue.description: Indicates that reauthorization is not supported for this transaction or payment method.

enum: A reauthorize cannot be attempted on an authorization_id that is the result of a prior reauthorization or on an authorization made on an Order saved using the `v2/orders/id/save` API.
description.description: Error message indicating reauthorization is not supported for this authorization type.

REAUTHORIZATIONNOTSUPPORTED.description: Error indicating reauthorization is not supported for previously reauthorized or saved order authorizations.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

custom_id.description: The API caller-provided external ID. Used to reconcile API caller-initiated transactions with PayPal transactions. Appears in transaction and settlement reports.

AuthorizationAllOf2.description: Contains authorization-specific details including ID, amount, invoice information, seller protection, expiration, and related links.

REFUNDFAILEDINSUFFICIENTFUNDS.title: REFUND_FAILED_INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS

issue.description: Indicates a refund failure due to insufficient funds in the source account.

enum: Capture could not be refunded due to insufficient funds. Please check to see if you have sufficient funds in your PayPal account or if the bank account linked to your PayPal account is verified and has sufficient funds.
description.description: Error message indicating refund failure due to insufficient funds in PayPal or linked bank account.

REFUNDFAILEDINSUFFICIENTFUNDS.description: Capture refund failed due to insufficient funds in PayPal account or linked bank account.

PAYEEACCOUNTRESTRICTED.description: Indicates that the payee's account has restrictions that prevent processing the payment transaction.

merchant_id.description: Unique identifier for the merchant account associated with the payee.

enum: The value of a field is either too short or too long.

description.description: Invoice ID already exists - potential duplicate transaction detected.

DUPLICATEINVOICEID1.title: DUPLICATE_INVOICE_ID

enum: Invoice ID was previously used to refund a capture.
description.description: Invoice ID was previously used to refund a capture.

DUPLICATEINVOICEID1.description: Indicates when an invoice ID has already been used for refunding a previous capture transaction.

409Details.description: Details for HTTP 409 Conflict response indicating a previous request is still in progress.

Authorizationsreauthorize422Details.description: Error details for authorization reauthorization failures, including currency, amount, account, and transaction status issues.

CANNOTBEZEROORNEGATIVE.title: CANNOT_BE_ZERO_OR_NEGATIVE

issue.description: Indicates that a value cannot be zero or negative and must be a positive number.

enum: Must be greater than zero. If the currency supports decimals, only two decimal place precision is supported.
description.description: Validation message indicating the value must be greater than zero with max two decimal places.

CANNOTBEZEROORNEGATIVE.description: Validation error indicating a value must be greater than zero with up to two decimal places.

REFUNDAMOUNTTOOLOW.title: REFUND_AMOUNT_TOO_LOW

issue.description: Indicates that the refund amount requested is below the minimum allowed threshold.

enum: The amount after applying currency conversion is zero and hence the capture cannot be refunded. The currency conversion is required because the currency of the capture is different than the currency in which the amount was settled into the payee account.
description.description: Error when refund amount becomes zero after currency conversion due to currency mismatch.

REFUNDAMOUNTTOOLOW.description: Refund amount becomes zero after currency conversion, preventing capture refund processing.

INVALIDCURRENCYCODE.title: INVALID_CURRENCY_CODE

issue.description: Indicates an invalid currency code error with the value "INVALID_CURRENCY_CODE".

enum: Currency code is invalid or is not currently supported. Please refer https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/reference/currency-codes/ for list of supported currency codes.
description.description: Error message indicating the currency code is invalid or unsupported by PayPal.

INVALIDCURRENCYCODE.description: Currency code is invalid or not supported. See PayPal currency codes documentation.

PENDINGCAPTURE.title: PENDING_CAPTURE

issue.description: Indicates a payment capture is pending completion with value "PENDING_CAPTURE".

enum: Cannot initiate a refund as the capture is pending. Capture is typically pending when the payer has funded the transaction using e-check/bank funded.
description.description: Status message indicating refund cannot be processed due to pending e-check/bank capture.

PENDINGCAPTURE.description: Payment capture is pending, preventing refund initiation (typically for e-check/bank transfers).

ActivityTimestamps.title: Transaction Date and Time Stamps

update_time.description: Timestamp indicating when the activity was last updated or modified.

create_time.description: Timestamp indicating when the activity was created, formatted as a DateTime value.

ActivityTimestamps.description: The date and time stamps that are common to authorized payment, captured payment, and refund transactions

PREVIOUSLYCAPTURED.title: PREVIOUSLY_CAPTURED

enum: Authorization has been previously captured and hence cannot be voided.
description.description: Error message indicating an authorization cannot be voided because it was already captured.

PREVIOUSLYCAPTURED.description: Indicates an authorization that was previously captured and cannot be voided.

PERMISSIONDENIED.title: PERMISSION_DENIED

issue.description: Indicates a permission denied error with the fixed value "PERMISSION_DENIED".

enum: You do not have permission to access or perform operations on this resource.
description.description: Error message indicating the user lacks permission to access or perform operations on the resource.

PERMISSIONDENIED.description: Error indicating insufficient permissions to access or perform operations on the requested resource.

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the captured payment.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

custom_id.description: The API caller-provided external ID. Used to reconcile API caller-initiated transactions with PayPal transactions. Appears in transaction and settlement reports.

final_capture.description: Indicates whether you can make additional captures against the authorized payment. Set to `true` if you do not intend to capture additional payments against the authorization. Set to `false` if you intend to capture additional payments against the authorization.

CaptureAllOf2.description: A captured payment containing transaction details, amounts, IDs, seller protection, and processing information.

Capturesrefund400Details.description: Details for 400 Bad Request errors in capture refund operations, including missing parameters, invalid syntax, or string length violations.

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml)

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call

ExchangeRate.title: Exchange Rate

source_currency.description: The currency code from which the exchange rate conversion is being made.

target_currency.description: The currency code to which the exchange rate converts from the base currency.

value.description: The target currency amount. Equivalent to one unit of the source currency. Formatted as integer or decimal value with one to 15 digits to the right of the decimal point

ExchangeRate.description: The exchange rate that determines the amount to convert from one currency to another currency

NetworkTransactionReference.title: Network Transaction Reference

date.description: The date that the transaction was authorized by the scheme. This field may not be returned for all networks. MasterCard refers to this field as "BankNet reference date

acquirer_reference_number.description: Reference ID issued for the card transaction. This ID can be used to track the transaction across processors, card brands and issuing banks

id.description: Transaction reference id returned by the scheme. For Visa and Amex, this is the "Tran id" field in response. For MasterCard, this is the "BankNet reference id" field in response. For Discover, this is the "NRID" field in response. The pattern we expect for this field from Visa/Amex/CB/Discover is numeric, Mastercard/BNPP is alphanumeric and Paysecure is alphanumeric with special character -

NetworkTransactionReference.description: Reference values used by the card network to identify a transaction

ProcessorResponse.title: Processor Response

cvv_code.description: The card verification value code for for Visa, Discover, Mastercard, or American Express

response_code.description: Processor response code for the non-PayPal payment processor errors

payment_advice_code.description: The declined payment transactions might have payment advice codes. The card networks, like Visa and Mastercard, return payment advice codes

avs_code.description: The address verification code for Visa, Discover, Mastercard, or American Express transactions

ProcessorResponse.description: The processor response information for payment requests, such as direct credit card transactions

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml)

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call

enum: Refund must be in the same currency as the capture

REFUNDCAPTURECURRENCYMISMATCH.description: Refund must be in the same currency as the capture.

Authorization2AllOf2.description: Contains supplementary data and payee information for authorization processing.

PaymentInstruction.title: Payment Instruction

disbursement_mode.description: The method or channel through which payment funds will be distributed or disbursed to the recipient.

platform_fees.description: An array of various fees, commissions, tips, or donations. This field is only applicable to merchants that been enabled for PayPal Commerce Platform for Marketplaces and Platforms capability

payee_receivable_fx_rate_id.description: FX identifier generated returned by PayPal to be used for payment processing in order to honor FX rate (for eligible integrations) to be used when amount is settled/received into the payee account

payee_pricing_tier_id.description: This field is only enabled for selected merchants/partners to use and provides the ability to trigger a specific pricing rate/plan for a payment transaction. The list of eligible 'payee_pricing_tier_id' would be provided to you by your Account Manager. Specifying values other than the one provided to you by your account manager would result in an error

PaymentInstruction.description: Any additional payment instructions to be consider during payment processing. This processing instruction is applicable for Capturing an order or Authorizing an Order

description.description: Error message indicating currency mismatch between original authorization and reauthorization request.

AUTHCURRENCYMISMATCH.description: Currency mismatch between original authorization and reauthorization request.

Money.title: Money

value.description:
The value, which might be:
  • An integer for currencies like `JPY` that are not typically fractional.
  • A decimal fraction for currencies like `TND` that are subdivided into thousandths.
For the required number of decimal places for a currency code, see [Currency Codes](/api/rest/reference/currency-codes/)

currency_code.description: The ISO 4217 three-letter currency code indicating the monetary unit for this amount.

Money.description: The currency and amount for a financial transaction, such as a balance or payment due

capture_id.description: Capture ID related to the resource

order_id.description: Order ID related to the resource

items.description: The condition that is covered for the transaction.

payable_amount.description: The monetary amount that is due to be paid for this breakdown item.

platform_fees.description: An array of platform or partner fees, commissions, or brokerage fees for the refund

net_amount_in_receivable_currency.description: The net amount owed to the merchant in the receivable currency after deductions and adjustments.

total_refunded_amount.description: Total amount refunded to customers for this merchant, represented as a monetary value.

paypal_fee.description: The PayPal fee amount deducted from the transaction, represented as a monetary value.

gross_amount.description: The total gross amount before any deductions, expressed as a monetary value.

paypal_fee_in_receivable_currency.description: The PayPal fee amount expressed in the receivable currency for this merchant transaction.

net_amount.description: The net amount payable to the merchant, representing the final settlement value after deductions.

net_amount_breakdown.description: An array of breakdown values for the net amount. Returned when the currency of the refund is different from the currency of the PayPal account where the payee holds their funds

id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the refund.

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

custom_id.description: The API caller-provided external ID. Used to reconcile API caller-initiated transactions with PayPal transactions. Appears in transaction and settlement reports.

acquirer_reference_number.description: Reference ID issued for the card transaction. This ID can be used to track the transaction across processors, card brands and issuing banks.

note_to_payer.description: The reason for the refund. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives.

RefundAllOf2.description: A PayPal refund object containing refund details, amount, payer information, and transaction references.

AuthorizationVoidValidationError.description: Validation error response for authorization void operations, combining standard 422 error with void-specific error details.

CaptureRequest.title: Capture Request
CaptureRequest.description: Captures either a portion or the full authorized amount of an authorized payment

invoice_id.description: The API caller-provided external invoice number for this order. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives

note_to_payer.description: An informational note about this settlement. Appears in both the payer's transaction history and the emails that the payer receives

DisbursementMode.title: Disbursement Mode
DisbursementMode.description: The funds that are held on behalf of the merchant

PlatformFee.title: Platform Fee
PlatformFee.description: The platform or partner fee, commission, or brokerage fee that is associated with the transaction. Not a separate or isolated transaction leg from the external perspective. The platform fee is limited in scope and is always associated with the original payment for the purchase unit

CapturesRefundValidationErrorResponse.description: Validation error response for capture refund requests, combining standard 422 error format with refund-specific error details.

MAXCAPTURECOUNTEXCEEDED.title: MAX_CAPTURE_COUNT_EXCEEDED

issue.description: Indicates that the maximum number of allowed capture attempts has been exceeded.

enum: Maxmimum number of allowable captures has been reached. No additional captures are possible for this authorization. Contact Customer Service or your account manager to change the number of captures for a given authorization.
description.description: Error message indicating the maximum capture limit has been reached for an authorization.

MAXCAPTURECOUNTEXCEEDED.description: Maximum allowable captures reached for this authorization. Contact Customer Service to modify limits.

authorization_id.name: authorizationId
authorization_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the authorized payment to void

paypal_request_id.name: PayPal-Request-Id
paypal_request_id.description: The server stores keys for 45 days

prefer.name: Prefer
prefer.description:
The preferred server response upon successful completion of the request. Value is:
  • return=minimal. The server returns a minimal response to optimize communication between the API caller and the server. A minimal response includes the id, status and HATEOAS links.
  • return=representation. The server returns a complete resource representation, including the current state of the resource.

paypal_auth_assertion.name: PayPal-Auth-Assertion
paypal_auth_assertion.description:
An API-caller-provided JSON Web Token (JWT) assertion that identifies the merchant. For details, see [PayPal-Auth-Assertion](/docs/api/reference/api-requests/#paypal-auth-assertion).
Note:For three party transactions in which a partner is managing the API calls on behalf of a merchant, the partner must identify the merchant using either a PayPal-Auth-Assertion header or an access token with target_subject.

capture_id.name: captureId
capture_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the captured payment to refund

refund_id.name: refundId
refund_id.description: The PayPal-generated ID for the refund for which to show details

scopes.https://uri.paypal.com/services/payments: Permission to do non-real time payments like capture on authorization
Permission to initiate a refund on a capture transaction
Permission to initiate non referenced credit
Permission to do any real time payment, with support for sale/authorize/order intents
Permission to do any reverse payment
